fields.headline: Snow show
fields.bodyText: The slopes are good in Austria and Switzerland thanks to new snow. However, the French resorts are in need of a dump of snow. Powder conditions exist in California and Utah and things are looking up in Canada. Austria In Kitzbuhel (***) heavy snow has been falling. Next week looks good for Soll (***), Obergurgl (****) and Mayrhofen (***). France For the best snow head to Montgenevre (****) and Serre Chevalier (****). Switzerland A small amount of new snow has fallen inDavos (****) and Klosters (****). The pistes of Zermatt (****) and St Moritz (****) are still very good. Italy Despite a couple of weeks with very little new snow, the pistes in Madonna di Campiglio (***) are still good with perfect ski and board conditions, low temperatures and bright sunshine. Cervinia (****) also has excellent on piste conditions. Andorra More snow will be needed soon on the lower slopes of Soldeu (***) and Pas de la Casa (***) although the upper slopes are still in good condition. North America Resorts such as Mammoth (****) and Squaw Valley (****) have had up to 40cm of new snow. Utah has also received some new snow, and Solitude (****) has had over 25cm of new snow in the past few days. In Canada, there has been some more snow in Fernie (****), Whistler (****) and the Banff Ski Area (***). Liz Russell, The Ski Club of Great Britain  Key to conditions: No snowflakes = a serious lack of snow - no lifts open. * = poor snow conditions, very few lifts open. ** = conditions reasonable, some slopes in poor condition.*** = plenty of good skiing.**** = good conditions.***** = fantastic on and off piste. For the latest snow conditions in more than 250 resorts, check out www.skiclub.co.uk
